result.execSummary:
The defendant Ali A Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Reimburse Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit for "buy money" in the amount of $250.00.  
If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
----------------------------

Shall not associate with any known drug users except for treatment without Agent's prior permission. Maintain Absolute sobriety. No contact with known gang members.
----------------------------

Cognitive Behavioral Therapy as deemed necessary. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------

Alcohol and drug assessment and treatment as deemed necessary.
----------------------------

BOND QUASHED

3:07 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Ali A Ortiz in court, in custody with attorney Jeramiah Maynard.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
The Court has reviewed the PSI, the defendant's sentencing memorandum and the letters of support submitted by the Defense.
Attorney Maynard has reviewed the PSI with Ms. Ortiz and he does not have any corrections.
3:08 pm  Attorney Necci makes a record with regard to victim notification.  
3:08 pm  Attorney Necci will be taking testimony from Deputy Newmann but wishes to give the Court some background first.  
3:11 pm  Deputy Cory Newmann is sworn and testifies on exam of Attorney Necci.  
3:21 pm  Cross exam by Attorney Maynard.  
3:23 pm  Witness excused.  
3:24 pm  Argument as to sentence by Attorney Necci.  
3:30 pm  Argument as to sentence by Attorney Maynard.  
3:42 pm  Statement by Mary Bouchard, mother of the defendant, (appearing by telephone) on behalf of her daughter, the defendant.  
3:44 pm  Statement by Carlos Ortiz, father of the defendant, on behalf of his daughter, the defendant.  
3:47 pm  Statement by Defendant.  
3:51 pm  Court takes recess to consider this matter and will resume at 4:15 pm
4:21 pm  Court in session.  
4:21 pm  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

Count #1, file 2015CF000497:  
FOUR (4) years IC followed by THREE (3) years ES

Count #4, file 2015CF000497:
TWO (2) years IC followed by TWO (2) years ES, concurrent with Ct #1

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
1)  Alcohol and drug assessment and treatment as deemed necessary
2)  Cognitive Behavioral Therapy as deemed necessary
3)  Shall not associate with any known drug users except for treatment without Agent's prior permission.  
4)  Maintain absolute sobriety
5)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
7)  Reimburse $250.00 in buy money to Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit.  
8)  No contact with known gang members

One Hundred Thirty-five (135) days of sentence credit
ELIGIBLE for CIP and SAP

Count #1, file 2015CM000364:
NINE (9) MONTHS in WCJ, consec to Count #1, Case 2015CF000497

Count #2, file 2015CM000364:
NINE (9) months in WCJ, consec to Count #1, Case 2015CF000497 and concurrent with Count #1, Case 2015CM000364

Pay Court costs on Counts #1 and #2, Case 2015CM000364

4:33 pm  Court in recess.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party. CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH KAYLA GACHES OR JUSTIN HONSE.
